markdownRemark.html:
Note: Currently Remote debugging is not supported for Linux OS.

This is a step-by-step guide to connect your Visual Studio into Azure for remote debugging.

After trying the Cloud Explorer in VS2019 without sucess I needed to figure out a different way to connect to Azure with the remote debugger.

Remote debugging in VS 2019:

  1. Go to your App Service in the Azure Portal.

  2. Click Get publish profile in the menu bar of the Overview section. It should look like this with more stuff:

    <publishData>
<publishProfile userName="{username}"
                userPWD="{password}"
                destinationAppUrl="http://blah.azurewebsites.net"
                ...
                >
    <databases />
</publishProfile>
...
</publishData>
  3. Now go to the Configuration sidebar and click General settings and turn Remote Debugging on.
  4. In Visual Studio go to the menu bar and click Debug > Attach to process...
  5. In the Connection target: box use the destinationAppUrl from your publish profile without http(s): and add the port :4022. (e.g. blah-001.azurewebsites.net:4022)
  6. Press enter and use the userName and userPWD from the publish profile in the credentials.
  7. Click the w3wp process and connect.

I hope this guide is useful and helps you solve some problems!
